description: Runs an SQL statement, which can be data manipulation language (DML) or data definition language (DDL). This statement must be a single SQL statement. Depending on the authorization method, use one of the following combinations of request parameters: For more information about the Amazon Redshift Data API and CLI usage examples, see Using the Amazon Redshift Data API in the Amazon Redshift Management Guide.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: Parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the SQL statement. (dict) --- A parameter used in a SQL statement. The name of the parameter. The value of the parameter. Amazon Redshift implicitly converts to the proper data type. For more information, see Data types in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The value of the parameter. Amazon Redshift implicitly converts to the proper data type. For more information, see Data types in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide.

parameters.name: Sql
parameters.description: The SQL statement text to run.

nested_items.name: ClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The cluster identifier. This element is not returned when connecting to a serverless workgroup.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time (UTC) the statement was created.

nested_items.name: DbGroups
nested_items.description: A list of colon (:) separated names of database groups.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier of the SQL statement whose results are to be fetched. This value is a universally unique identifier (UUID) generated by Amazon Redshift Data API.

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The name or ARN of the secret that enables access to the database.

nested_items.name: SessionId
nested_items.description: The session identifier of the query.

nested_items.name: WorkgroupName
nested_items.description: The serverless workgroup name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN). This element is not returned when connecting to a provisioned cluster.
